en.purpose: To predict presence of pericardial or intra-abdominal injury after penetrating or blunt trauma.
en.use: FAST should be used liberally in the evaluation of trauma patients. Especially useful in patients with penetrating thoracic trauma and in unstable patients after blunt abdominal trauma. Using bedside ultrasound, assess for fluid in each of the following areas: Pericardial fluid Right upper quadrant (Morison’s pouch) fluid Left upper quadrant (splenorenal recess) fluid Suprapubic fluid Fluid present? Select: Absent/ Present/ Equivocal. Interpretation: - ONE of the areas has Present fluid: Present FAST - NON of the areas has Present fluid AND one or more area has Equivocal: Equivocal FAST - ALL areas has Absent fluid: Absent FAST
en.misuse: Do not use FAST results alone to dictate the decision to operate. Negative FAST result does NOT exclude injury.

other_details.references: 1. Rozycki GS, Ochsner MG, Jaffin JH, Champion HR. Prospective evaluation of surgeons' use of ultrasound in the evaluation of trauma patients. J Trauma. 1993 Apr;34(4):516-26.

when: ($gt0006|Pericardial fluid|==local::at0009|Present|)||(($gt0007|Right upper quadrant (Morison’s pouch) fluid|==local::at0009|Present|)||(($gt0008|Left upper quadrant (splenorenal recess) fluid|==local::at0009|Present|)||($gt0009|Suprapubic fluid|==local::at0009|Present|)))

($gt0006|Pericardial fluid|==local::at0010|Equivocal|)||(($gt0007|Right upper quadrant (Morison’s pouch) fluid|==local::at0010|Equivocal|)||(($gt0008|Left upper quadrant (splenorenal recess) fluid|==local::at0010|Equivocal|)||($gt0009|Suprapubic fluid|==local::at0010|Equivocal|)))

($gt0007|Right upper quadrant (Morison’s pouch) fluid|==local::at0009|Present|)||(($gt0008|Left upper quadrant (splenorenal recess) fluid|==local::at0009|Present|)||($gt0009|Suprapubic fluid|==local::at0009|Present|))

($gt0007|Right upper quadrant (Morison’s pouch) fluid|==local::at0009|Present|)||(($gt0008|Left upper quadrant (splenorenal recess) fluid|==local::at0009|Present|)||($gt0009|Suprapubic fluid|==local::at0009|Present|))

($gt0007|Right upper quadrant (Morison’s pouch) fluid|==local::at0010|Equivocal|)||(($gt0008|Left upper quadrant (splenorenal recess) fluid|==local::at0010|Equivocal|)||($gt0009|Suprapubic fluid|==local::at0010|Equivocal|))

gt0001.description: Focused Assessment with Sonography for Trauma (FAST) predicts presence of pericardial or intra-abdominal injury after penetrating or blunt trauma.

gt0003.description: The result of the FAST assessment.

gt0010.text: Negative FAST does not exclude injury.

gt0011.text: Surgical intervention warranted for suspected hemopericardium. Median sternotomy preferred if stable; otherwise, use left anterolateral thoracotomy.

gt0012.text: Pericardial window or formal transthoracic echocardiography (TTE) recommended to rule out hemopericardium.

gt0013.text: Pericardial window or formal transthoracic echocardiography (TTE) recommended for equivocal pericardial view.

gt0014.text: Emergent ex lap indicated in unstable patients for suspected hemoperitoneum.

gt0015.text: Emergent ex lap indicated for hemoperitoneum in unstable patients.

gt0016.text: Recommend diagnostic peritoneal aspiration (DPA) to rule out hemoperitoneum if unstable. If stable, recommend CT.

gt0021.text: Set recommendation for pericardial fluid present

gt0022.text: Set recommendation for abdominal fluid present

gt0023.text: Set recommendation for abdominal fluid present and pericardial fluid equivocal

gt0024.text: Set recommendation for pericardial fluid equivocal

gt0025.text: Set recommendation for pericardial fluid equivocal and abdominal fluid present

gt0026.text: Set recommendation for abdominal fluid equivocal

gt0027.text: Set recommendation when FAST is negative
